origins.question: What island is considered the Principle Island of the Ryukyu Archipelago?
Who is believed to have brought Chuan-Fa to the Shaolin temple in China during the Sung Dynasty?
What event in 1609 led to the development of a fighting method known as 'Te' (hand)?
options: Japanese Satsuma Clan's march on the Ryukyu Islands
Declaration of allegiance by King Satto
origins.correctAnswer: Japanese Satsuma Clan's march on the Ryukyu Islands

origins.question: Who is commonly known as the father of modern-day karate?
Which virtue of Bushido emphasizes the importance of treating others with courtesy and consideration?

elements.question: What are the three basic Elements of good Karate?
Which Element of Karate is often considered the Spirit of Karate?
What is the purpose of practicing Kihon in Karate training?
options: To simulate fights against imaginary opponents
To develop strategy and mental fortitude
To establish a solid foundation and proper technique
elements.correctAnswer: To establish a solid foundation and proper technique

elements.question: What are Kata in the context of Karate?
options: Prearranged sequences of movements and techniques
Controlled and supervised combat between two practitioners
elements.correctAnswer: Prearranged sequences of movements and techniques

elements.question: Which of the following is true about Kumite in Karate
options: It is often performed in a specific pattern
It involves controlled and supervised combat between two practitioners
It is primarily focused on refining form and technique
elements.correctAnswer: It involves controlled and supervised combat between two practitioners

stances.question: What is the weight distribution for the Zenkutsu-dachi (Front stance)?
options: 50% on front leg, 50% on back leg
30% on front leg, 70% on back leg
70% on front leg, 30% on back leg
90% on front leg, 10% on back leg
stances.correctAnswer: 70% on front leg, 30% on back leg

stances.question: Which stance is the most technically challenging and hardest to master in Shotokan karate?
What is the stance used in Shotokan karate kata Sochin, combining half front stance and half horse riding stance?
In which stance are the feet placed together, side by side, and the heels together with toes turned out at roughly 45 degrees?
What is the weight distribution for Heisoku-dachi (Feet Together Stance)
options: 70% on one leg, 30% on the other leg
90% on one leg, 10% on the other leg
